body:
First off, I would like to congratulate the PowerPuff Boys on winning Race to Victory! Prizes will be distributed soon.

Pel's Retirement; A Thank You:

Sadly, yesterday was hindered with Pelpelajax's retirement. He was a great official. Please thank him if you see him.

Things We Can Improve On:

Please reply down below if you have another things that are not listed here.

  • Fix Servers. Way too laggy.
  • Fix maps. Way too skybridged based, and stalemated. 
  • Improve on detecting hackers during a tournament match. We are very sorry EC. 
Updates/Announcements:
First off, I would like to say that there will not be another "big" tournament for a while. Don't worry! Instead, we will be having small, 1 day mini-tournaments with varying gamemodes. 
New Officials? With Pelpelajax's retirement, there will be new officials. Yes, plural. Expect that very soon. 
I can promise that lots of good things are coming!

Avicus Leagues? What did you just say?
Stay tuned for more imformation. Again, coming very soon. 

Our Goals:

Basically, we want to improve Avicus' player count with tournaments. More players = better tournaments. We also want to provide good, fun tournaments.

Get hyped!
Regards, 
The Officials :)

The Officials :)

replies.body: Many other stuff are "coming very soon" and we've been waiting too long IMO. But from this tourney organization there is a lot to improve, the things that you listed are right, also get way more organized on the streaming side. No way only one streamer for 2 rounds with terrible quality, impossible to watch. Overall I'd rate 5/10 but it's good for the start and I'm happy to see it went partly smoothly, looking forward to the league as well. I'd like to get more info about the league if possible.

replies.body:
In my opinion the stream and the referees were all horrible, yet fairly good.

Streamers need to get some kind of spectator mode that allowes them to not show their hand. Carpets would work, but from what I saw in the stream there were a lot of issues.
Co-commentators should be decided like a month before the actual matches and shouldnt be some ocn randies making jive give them a rank. It was honestly sad to so.

Refs shouldnt be using caps or spam the chat, which they did. 

Dont let medias spectate, only allowe the the person with The media rank who is streaming be allowed on the server.

-----

For next tm, have everything ready such as maps. There were some last minute changes which people wouldnt be able to see.

Also have proper supply rooms, aint no one got time to have planks in their inv.

replies.body:
I don't think I could have asked for a better finals, win or not, it was probably one of the best matches I have ever played, both on Avicus and on OCN. I could have not asked for a better experience.
Shout out to my boys, I can't express how dear you all are to me, I fucking love all of you. I couldn't ask for a better, and more enjoyable team to lead. 
Also, BC you all as a whole have a long way ahead of you, so keep going, probably one of the most challenging teams I would have to play against. TBH, when we lost on Sunbeam, I didn't think we would pull it off, but you guys are batshit crazy insane at this, keep it going mates.
Finally, thanks for the tournament staff :u Better than the last one for certain.

reply_to.body:
In my opinion the stream and the referees were all horrible, yet fairly good.

Streamers need to get some kind of spectator mode that allowes them to not show their hand. Carpets would work, but from what I saw in the stream there were a lot of issues.
Co-commentators should be decided like a month before the actual matches and shouldnt be some ocn randies making jive give them a rank. It was honestly sad to so.

Refs shouldnt be using caps or spam the chat, which they did. 

Dont let medias spectate, only allowe the the person with The media rank who is streaming be allowed on the server.

-----

For next tm, have everything ready such as maps. There were some last minute changes which people wouldnt be able to see.

Also have proper supply rooms, aint no one got time to have planks in their inv.

replies.body:
Tbh, they were pretty insane. 1 match reached 45 minutes, the other 2 43. Deltah fucking clutched for you guys when I was on my side with the wool on Sand Ocean lmfao. They were probably the most intense matches ever lmfao. 

We're not disbanding, BmB just stepped down :c 

Sorry for any salt, players should've been mad at the map, not you guys or Ihze. Hey, we nearly won by me underbriding afterwards anyway :) ggwp

Most intense matches I've had in my life, both teams clutching each other every minute, Glitchy getting the wool seconds away from the end of the match and Delta getting Tazz whilst being 5 blocks away from the monument.

Was a pleasure to play against you PPB, gg.

Only thing I didn't like about this was the server being fully 1.7, the lag spikes were annoying since I never got them whilst using 1.8.
